metadata.title: মুরগির মাংস দিয়ে ছাঁচের পিঠে | Murgir Mangso Diye Chhacher Pithe | Rural Recipes | #villagefood

transcription_bengali: [00:00:19.000] আমরা নদিয়া জেলার পুরুলিয়া নামে একটা গ্রামে এসেছি।
[00:00:24.000] আমরা এখানে পিঠে শুট করতে এসেছিলাম।
[00:00:24.000] পিঠে শুট করতে এসে আমরা দুটো নতুন রেসিপিও পেয়েছিলাম।
[00:00:27.000] আর সেই বাড়িতেই আজ আবার এসেছি।
[00:00:32.000] উত্তরা দিদির একটা বিশেষ পরিচয় আছে।
[00:00:36.000] তিনি একজন গায়িকা—গান ভালোবাসেন, গান করেন।
[00:00:43.000] সেদিন কথা বলতে বলতে উত্তরা দিদি বলেছিলেন—পিঠে মাংসের সঙ্গেও খাওয়া যায়।
[00:00:48.000] আর সেই জন্যই আজ তিনি দেশি মুরগির একটা পদ আমাদের সঙ্গে শেয়ার করবেন।
[00:01:00.000] একটা পিঠে হবে। সেই পিঠেটা সবজির পিঠে।
[00:01:04.000] ওই সবজির পিঠেটা মুরগির ঝোল/মাংসের সঙ্গে খাওয়া হবে।
[00:01:16.000] এখন বুঝলাম—ধনে পাতার পিঠে আলাদা খাওয়া যায়,
[00:01:21.000] আমি চেখে দেখব, আপনারাও প্রক্রিয়াটা দেখবেন।
[00:01:36.000] লঙ্কা বাটা আর গরম মশলা বাটা।
[00:03:55.000] আমার মনে হয় এই রেসিপিতে দুটো ট্রিক আছে।
[00:05:02.000] মুরগি রান্না হতে একটু সময় লাগবে।
[00:07:06.000] আমরা ছাঁচের পিঠে বানিয়ে ফেললাম—এটা মুরগির মাংসের সঙ্গে খাওয়া হবে। (ট্রান্সক্রিপ্টে লাইন অস্পষ্ট/ভুল ছিল)
[00:07:47.000] তাহলে এখন যেহেতু একটু সময় পেলাম, আমি বলতে চাই—
[00:07:52.000] না, আমি ভাবছিলাম আপনি আর দু’টো গান গাইবেন।
[00:08:20.000] এবার আজকের বানানো মাংসের সঙ্গে এটা খাব।
[00:08:55.000] আজ দেখলাম খুব কম মশলায়ও কীভাবে দারুণ রান্না হয়।
[00:09:07.000] আপনার গ্রাম বা এলাকার কোনো ইন্টারেস্টিং রেসিপি জানতে চাইলে,
[00:09:14.000] আর সেটার বানানোর পদ্ধতি জানতে চাইলে—
[00:09:19.000] আমরা সেটা যাচাই করে আপনাদের কাছে পৌঁছে যাব।
[00:10:04.000] আরও তথ্যের জন্য ভিজিট করুন: www.osho.com
transcription_english: [00:00:19.000] We have come to a village called Purulia in Nadia district.
[00:00:24.000] We had come here to shoot an episode on pitha.
[00:00:24.000] While shooting pitha, we also found two new recipes.
[00:00:27.000] And today we have come back to that same house again.
[00:00:30.000] We have come to Uttara-di’s house.
[00:00:32.000] It’s fair to say Uttara-di has a special identity.
[00:00:36.000] She is a singer—she loves singing and she sings.
[00:00:40.000] Today we have come to her house for the second time.
[00:00:42.000] And there is a reason for that.
[00:00:43.000] That day, while talking, Uttara-di said pitha can also be eaten with meat.
[00:00:48.000] And for that, today she will share a desi chicken preparation with us.
[00:00:52.000] This also has a uniqueness—what is the uniqueness?
[00:00:58.000] the chicken will be cooked, and along with it
[00:01:00.000] there will be a pitha—this pitha is a vegetable pitha.
[00:01:04.000] That vegetable pitha will be eaten with the chicken curry/meat.
[00:01:12.000] The coriander-leaf pitha can be eaten separately. Okay.
[00:01:16.000] Now I understand—coriander-leaf pitha can be eaten on its own,
[00:01:18.000] and the vegetable pitha is eaten with chicken.
[00:01:21.000] I will taste it, and you can watch the process.
[00:01:24.000] First we’ll prepare the chicken. Tell us—
[00:01:27.000] what do we need? We have chopped onions,
[00:01:36.000] chili paste and garam masala paste.
[00:01:48.000] The chicken is cut and ready.
[00:01:51.000] You’ll add potatoes as well, right? Yes.
[00:01:54.000] And the potatoes have been pre-fried. Yes.
[00:01:56.000] The pan is hot—now I’m adding oil.
[00:02:00.000] I’ll coat the chicken with salt and turmeric.
[00:02:02.000] I’ll add salt according to the quantity.
[00:02:07.000] If needed later, you can add more again? Yes.
[00:02:13.000] Only salt and turmeric. You’ll add oil too, right? Yes.
[00:02:43.000] Now I’ll add the paste/spice pastes.
[00:02:49.000] What are you adding now? Garlic.
[00:02:51.000] About one and a half spoons.
[00:03:19.000] I’m frying/sautéing on a high flame.
[00:03:49.000] Then I’ll cover it with a lid.
[00:03:55.000] I think there are two tricks in this recipe.
[00:04:06.000] cooking it on a high flame.
[00:04:23.000] Now it’s time to add the potatoes.
[00:04:47.000] It has a very nice color.
[00:04:50.000] Do I have to add water now?
[00:04:54.000] Now it has to cook for some time.
[00:05:02.000] The chicken will take a bit more time to cook.
[00:05:04.000] So we will make the pitha.
[00:05:17.000] We have come here to make the pitha.
[00:05:20.000] Now we will make the pitha.
[00:05:21.000] The process is the same, right?
[00:06:41.000] It has turned out to be a very nice pitha.
[00:07:06.000] We have finished making the chhacher pitha—this will be eaten with the chicken curry.
[00:07:47.000] So, since we have a little time now, I would like to say—
[00:07:52.000] No, I was thinking you would sing a couple more songs.
[00:07:56.000] That was very nice. Now let me taste it.
[00:07:59.000] So I will eat this with the meat, right?
[00:08:04.000] This is a coriander-leaf chhacher pitha.
[00:08:07.000] This one is made with chilies.
[00:08:08.000] It has chilies and coriander leaves.
[00:08:13.000] You can eat it without any discomfort.
[00:08:20.000] Now I will eat it with the meat cooked today.
[00:08:39.000] The salt, the heat—everything is perfect.
[00:08:43.000] Honestly, my grandmother used to say—
[00:08:50.000] to cook well you don’t need lots of oil and spices;
[00:08:53.000] you have to cook with your heart.
[00:08:55.000] So today I saw how tasty food can be made with very little spices.
